page.title: 05Wormleighton The Residents
page.content: The estate cottages built for farm workers are chiefly occupied by people who work elsewhere. Only two farm workers remain. It is almost essential to own a car since the only daily deliveries are post, bread and milk. The bus service runs twice on a Thursday into Banbury. Activities in the village consist of a monthly whist drive, residents must travel for other leisure activities. It is no longer a closely knit community and even in such a small village it is possible not to know other residents. The church life is almost non-existent and it can be lonely living here. The Manor House is ageing and the Tudor battlements shed their stones when the low flying air force planes whiz overhead with a deafening roar.
